meanings.sent1: The classroom was noisy with students chatting loudly.
meanings.sent2: The party was so noisy that it was hard to hear conversations.
meanings.sent3: The noisy birds outside my window woke me up early.
meanings.sent4: The noisy traffic sounded like a never-ending symphony.
meanings.sent5: The noisy construction work echoed through the neighborhood.

meanings.definition: Full of or characterized by noise
meanings.sent1: The busy market was noisy with vendors calling out their prices.
meanings.sent2: The city streets were always noisy with the sounds of cars and people.
meanings.sent3: The noisy kitchen was filled with the clatter of pots and pans.
meanings.sent4: The forest was surprisingly noisy with the rustling of leaves and chirping of birds.
meanings.sent5: The concert hall was noisy with the excitement of the audience before the show.

meanings.definition: Loud and unpleasant to listen to
meanings.sent1: The noisy alarm clock jolted me awake in the morning.
meanings.sent2: The noisy argument between the neighbors kept me up at night.
meanings.sent3: The noisy baby's cries could be heard throughout the house.
meanings.sent4: The noisy engine of the old car sputtered and coughed.
meanings.sent5: The noisy thunderstorm rumbled ominously in the distance.
